sections.content: Welcome to Babel. These Terms of Service ("Terms") govern your use of the Babel mobile application (the "App") operated by Third Origin L.L.C-FZ ("we," "our," or "us"). By accessing or using the App, you agree to be bound by these Terms.

sections.title: IMPORTANT MEDICAL DISCLAIMER
sections.content:
Babel provides INFORMATIONAL CONTENT ONLY and is NOT a substitute for professional medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment. The safety assessments, recommendations, and information provided by the App are for general educational purposes only.

ALWAYS consult with your doctor, midwife, or qualified healthcare provider before making any decisions about products, medications, foods, or activities during pregnancy.

Never disregard professional medical advice or delay seeking it because of information you read in this App. If you have a medical emergency, call your doctor or emergency services immediately.

sections.title: 1. Acceptance of Terms
sections.content:
By creating an account or using the App, you confirm that you:

• Are at least 13 years of age
• Have read and understood these Terms
• Agree to be bound by these Terms and our Privacy Policy
• Understand that Babel does not provide medical advice

sections.title: 2. Description of Service
sections.content:
Babel is a pregnancy safety information app that allows you to:

• Scan product barcodes to receive safety information
• Ask questions about ingredients, products, and activities
• View trimester-specific guidance
• Track your scan and query history

Our assessments are generated using AI technology and publicly available research. While we strive for accuracy, we cannot guarantee that all information is complete, current, or error-free.

sections.title: 3. Account Terms
sections.content:
• You must provide a valid phone number for verification
• You are responsible for maintaining the security of your account
• You must not share your account with others
• You must notify us immediately of any unauthorized access
• We reserve the right to suspend or terminate accounts that violate these Terms

sections.title: 4. Subscription and Quotas
sections.content:
• Free tier users have limited monthly scans, queries, and history views
• Paid subscriptions provide increased or unlimited usage
• Quotas reset monthly on your billing cycle
• Subscription fees are non-refundable except as required by law
• We may modify pricing or features with reasonable notice

sections.title: 5. User Responsibilities
sections.content:
You agree NOT to:

• Use the App for any illegal purpose
• Attempt to circumvent usage limits or security measures
• Submit false or misleading information
• Use automated systems to access the App without permission
• Reverse engineer or attempt to extract the App's source code
• Use the App to harm, harass, or mislead others

sections.title: 6. Intellectual Property
sections.content:
• The App, including its design, features, and content, is owned by Third Origin L.L.C-FZ
• You may not copy, modify, or distribute our proprietary content
• Product information may be sourced from third-party databases
• Safety assessments are generated content and remain our intellectual property

sections.title: 7. Limitation of Liability and Damages Exclusion
sections.content:
TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW:

• The App is provided "AS IS" without warranties of any kind
• We do not guarantee the accuracy, completeness, or reliability of safety assessments
• We are not liable for any health outcomes resulting from use of the App
• We are not liable for indirect, incidental, or consequential damages
• Our total liability shall not exceed the amount you paid for the App in the past 12 months

We expressly disclaim liability for any physical harm, bodily injury, emotional distress, psychological damages, mental anguish, or any health-related outcomes (including but not limited to pregnancy complications, birth defects, miscarriage, fetal harm, allergic reactions, or any other adverse health effects) that may result from your use of or reliance on information provided by the App.

You acknowledge that the App provides general informational content only, and that any decisions you make based on this information are made at your own risk. We strongly recommend consulting with qualified healthcare professionals before making any health-related decisions.

sections.title: 8. Indemnification
sections.content: You agree to indemnify and hold harmless Third Origin L.L.C-FZ, its officers, directors, employees, and agents from any claims, damages, or expenses arising from your use of the App or violation of these Terms.

sections.title: 9. Termination
sections.content:
• You may delete your account at any time through the App
• We may suspend or terminate your access for Terms violations
• Upon termination, your right to use the App ceases immediately
• Provisions that by nature should survive will remain in effect

sections.title: 10. Changes to Terms
sections.content: We may modify these Terms at any time. Material changes will be communicated through the App or other means. Continued use after changes constitutes acceptance of the updated Terms.

sections.title: 11. Governing Law
sections.content: These Terms are governed by the laws of the United Arab Emirates. Subject to the arbitration provisions below, any disputes shall be resolved in the courts of Dubai, UAE.

sections.title: 12. Binding Arbitration
sections.content:
PLEASE READ THIS SECTION CAREFULLY. IT AFFECTS YOUR LEGAL RIGHTS, INCLUDING YOUR RIGHT TO FILE A LAWSUIT IN COURT.

You and Third Origin L.L.C-FZ agree that any dispute, claim, or controversy arising out of or relating to these Terms or the use of the App shall be resolved through binding arbitration, rather than in court, except that either party may seek injunctive or other equitable relief in court for infringement of intellectual property rights.

Before initiating arbitration, you must first send a written notice of dispute to legal@thirdorigin.io describing the nature of the claim and the specific relief sought. We will attempt to resolve the dispute informally within 30 days. If the dispute is not resolved within 30 days, either party may proceed with arbitration.

Arbitration shall be administered by the Dubai International Arbitration Centre (DIAC) or, for users in the United States, by JAMS under its Streamlined Arbitration Rules. The arbitration shall be conducted in English. The arbitrator's decision shall be final and binding.

The arbitrator may award the same damages and relief that a court could award. However, the arbitrator may only award declaratory or injunctive relief in favor of the individual party seeking relief.

Notwithstanding the above, either party may bring an individual action in small claims court for disputes within the court's jurisdiction.

sections.title: 13. Class Action and Jury Trial Waiver
sections.content:
TO THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW:

• You agree that any dispute resolution proceedings will be conducted only on an individual basis and not in a class, consolidated, or representative action
• You waive any right to participate in a class action lawsuit or class-wide arbitration against Third Origin L.L.C-FZ
• You waive any right to bring claims as a plaintiff or class member in any purported class or representative proceeding
• The arbitrator may not consolidate more than one person's claims
• You waive the right to a trial by jury

If this class action waiver is found to be unenforceable, then the entirety of the arbitration provision shall be null and void, but all other provisions of these Terms shall remain in effect.

subsections.title: For Users in the European Union/European Economic Area
subsections.content: If you are a consumer in the EU/EEA, you may have additional rights under applicable consumer protection laws that cannot be waived by contract. Nothing in these Terms affects your statutory rights as a consumer. You have the right to lodge a complaint with your local data protection supervisory authority regarding our processing of your personal data under GDPR. Some limitations of liability may not apply to you under mandatory EU consumer protection laws.

subsections.title: For Users in the United Kingdom
subsections.content: If you are a consumer in the UK, you have legal rights under the Consumer Rights Act 2015 and other laws that cannot be excluded or limited. Nothing in these Terms affects these statutory rights. The limitations and exclusions in these Terms apply only to the extent permitted by applicable UK law.

subsections.title: For Users in California, USA
subsections.content:
If you are a California resident, you have certain rights under the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA). Please see our Privacy Policy for details on how to exercise these rights.

Pursuant to California Civil Code Section 1542, you acknowledge that you are waiving any rights with respect to claims that are unknown or unsuspected at the time of acceptance of these Terms. Section 1542 provides: "A general release does not extend to claims that the creditor or releasing party does not know or suspect to exist in his or her favor at the time of executing the release and that, if known by him or her, would have materially affected his or her settlement with the debtor or released party."

If you are a California resident and have a complaint, you may contact the Complaint Assistance Unit of the Division of Consumer Services of the California Department of Consumer Affairs at 1625 N. Market Blvd., Suite N 112, Sacramento, California 95834, or by telephone at (800) 952-5210.

subsections.title: For Users in Australia
subsections.content: If you are a consumer in Australia, you have certain rights under the Australian Consumer Law that cannot be excluded, restricted, or modified. Nothing in these Terms excludes, restricts, or modifies any consumer guarantee, right, or remedy conferred on you by the Australian Consumer Law that cannot be excluded, restricted, or modified by agreement. Our liability for breach of a consumer guarantee is limited, to the extent permitted by law, to resupplying the services or paying the cost of having them resupplied.

sections.title: 15. Severability
sections.content: If any provision of these Terms is found to be unenforceable or invalid by a court of competent jurisdiction, that provision shall be limited or eliminated to the minimum extent necessary so that these Terms shall otherwise remain in full force and effect and enforceable.

sections.title: 16. Contact Us
sections.content: For questions about these Terms, please contact us at:
